medical_history.chief_complaint: Burning epigastric pain radiating to the chest.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms presented with burning epigastric pain that has radiated to the chest and included episodes of emesis without nausea. The patient reported a prior episode 2 days ago and has had multiple episodes in the past, with the last episode occurring 2 days ago. Normally finds relief with omeprazole, but did not experience relief this time. He also reports about 10 lbs weight loss related to discomfort while swallowing.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history includes GERD, H. Pylori infection (treatment status unclear), hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and a previous open appendectomy.
